---
title: "Overview"
---

## High-level description
This `package.json` file defines the configuration and dependencies for a simple Node.js project named "chalk-example". It sets up a basic structure for a project that demonstrates the use of the chalk library, which is commonly used for styling console output in Node.js applications.

## Symbols

### Project Metadata
#### Description
The top-level fields in the `package.json` file provide metadata about the project.

| Name | Value | Description |
|:-----|:------|:------------|
| name | "chalk-example" | The name of the project |
| version | "1.0.0" | The current version of the project |
| type | "module" | Specifies that this project uses ECMAScript modules |
| description | "A simple example project to demonstrate the use of chalk" | A brief description of the project's purpose |
| main | "example.js" | The entry point of the application |
| author | "Your Name" | The author of the project |
| license | "MIT" | The license under which the project is distributed |

### scripts
#### Description
Defines npm scripts that can be run using `npm run &lt;script-name&gt;`.

| Name | Command | Description |
|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| start | "node example.js" | Runs the main example.js file using Node.js |

### dependencies
#### Description
Lists the project's dependencies that will be installed when running `npm install`.

| Dependency | Version | Description |
|:-----------|:--------|:------------|
| chalk | "^5.0.0" | A library for styling console output, using the caret (^) for version flexibility |

## Dependencies
| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| chalk | Used for styling console output in the Node.js application |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Value | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:------|:------------|
| type | string | "module" | Specifies that this project uses ECMAScript modules, allowing the use of `import` statements |

This `package.json` file sets up a basic Node.js project structure with a single dependency (chalk) and a simple start script. It's designed for demonstrating the use of the chalk library in a Node.js environment, using ECMAScript modules.
